t!/nI
left my home in Norfolk Virginia California on my m
ind./nI
straddled that Greyhound, and rode into Raleigh and on across Carol
ine./n
We had motor trouble that turned into a struggle, halfway across Alab
am'./nWell that
hound broke down and left us all stranded, in downtown Birmingh
am./n
Right away I brought me a through train ticket, ridin' across Mississippi
/nAnd I
was on the midnight flyer out of Birmingham, smokin' into New Orlea
ns./n
Somebody helped me get out of Louisiana, just to help me get to Houston
/n
There are people there who care a little about me,/nand they won't let the poor boy
down. Take it!/n
Sure as you're born they brought me a silk suit, put luggage in my h
and./nAnd I
woke up high over Albuquerque, on a jet to the promised l
and./n
Working on a T-bone steak I had a party, flyin' over to the golden s
tate./n
when the pilot told us in thirteen minutes he would set us at the /n
Swing low chariot come down easy, taxi to the terminal z
one./n
Cut your engines and cool your wings, and let me make it to the telep
hone./n
Los Angeles give me Norfolk Virginia, tidewater four ten o n
ine./n
Tell the folks back home this is the promised land callin',/nand the poor boy's on the
line./n
